**DATE[Apr 08 2007]
DISCHARGE DATE :
**DATE[Apr 18 2007]
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Status post multivisceral transplantation .
2. Status post kidney transplantation .
3. Bilateral lower extremity cellulitis .
4. Renal insufficiency .
This is a **AGE[in 40s]- year - old male patient with history of short gut syndrome secondary to AV malformation of stomach who underwent multivisceral transplantation in the past .
He also underwent kidney transplantation on **DATE[Mar 4 2007] .
The patient presented to 7 West for increased creatinine and swelling and cellulitis of his bilateral leg .
He was admitted to Dr. **NAME[ZZZ YYY] service and was put on Zyvox and ciprofloxacin .
We also performed the kidney biopsy on hospital day #2 , the finding of which was equivocal .
The infection of his bilateral leg was improved responding to antibiotic treatment .
But his creatinine was not improved until hospital day #7 .
We decided to give this patient 1 g of Solu - Medrol on **DATE[Apr 16 2007] .
On the day of discharge , his creatinine was 1.3 which is down to his baseline and the infection of his leg was much improved .
He is being discharged with continuous p.o. antibiotics which are Zyvox and ciprofloxacin and will be seen at 7 - West on **DATE[Apr 20 2007] for close observation .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. Cortef 35 mg p.o. t.i.d.
2. Bactrim single strength 1 tablet p.o. Monday , Wednesday , Friday .
3. Cytovene 500 mg p.o. t.i.d.
4. Actigall 300 mg p.o. t.i.d.
5. Nystatin swish and swallow 5 cc p.o. q.i.d.
6. Imodium 4 mg p.o. q.i.d.
7. Catapres patch 0.6 mg every week .
8. Aspirin 81 mg p.o. daily .
9. Protonix 40 mg p.o. b.i.d.
10. Lopressor 12.5 mg p.o. b.i.d.
11. Zoloft 50 mg p.o. daily .
12. Lyrica 50 mg p.o. daily .
13. Cardizem 60 mg p.o. t.i.d.
14. Multivitamin 1 tablet p.o. once a day .
15. Vitamin B6 25 mg p.o. daily .
16. Coumadin 3 mg p.o. nightly .
17. Zyvox 600 mg p.o. b.i.d.
18. Ciprofloxacin 500 mg p.o. b.i.d.
19. Florinef 0.1 mg p.o. once a day .
20. Sodium bicarbonate 1950 mg p.o. t.i.d.
21. Prograf 2 mg p.o. in the morning .
22. Prograf 2 mg p.o. in the evening .
